content: The "Free Market Royalty Act" amends the United States Code to change the broadcast performance right in sound recordings. It also aims to create a free market for licensing public performances. Section 114 of title 17, United States Code, is amended to change the broadcast performance right in sound recordings, creating a free market for licensing public performances. Amendments include altering references from "digital audio" to "audio" and removing certain subparagraphs and paragraphs.
